intro: Buphthalmum longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed ox-eye, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounding a central disc of tubular flowers, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Buphthalmum longipes thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
